## GAD-7 vs CFNS

Psychologists and social scientists commonly encounter the need to compare and harmonise items across different surveys or questionnaires. The challenge of comparing GAD-7 vs CFNS is one such instance. Both the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Child Food Neophobia Scale (CFNS) are valuable tools in their respective domains but understanding their interrelationships can often be a daunting task. Fortunately, the advancement in technology brought to us Harmony, a software developed specifically for aiding in these situations. Harmony utilizes natural language processing and generative AI models to harmonise items across different scales, even when they are in different languages. When it comes to GAD-7 vs CFNS, the software can analyze and give a percentage match for each item from the two scales. This advanced tool and its database come in handy in comparing a broad category range, from anxiety disorder symptoms to child's food neophobia behaviour patterns. Using Harmony for GAD-7 vs CFNS comparison does not only provide you with accurate, objective results, but it also greatly reduces the time that would have been spent on manual harmonisation. Its user-friendly interface allows you to select instruments from the software's database or upload your own instruments in PDF form. When dealing with GAD-7 vs CFNS comparison challenges, Harmony serves as an invaluable tool that remarkably improves efficiency and quality of research.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and CFNS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and CFNS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just CFNS into Harmony</a> - compare CFNS with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
